description.$value: Level 0. Foundational layer used for page navigation and as a container for insets.

Level 1. Represents the lowest layer in the stack. This is the foundation that everything else sits on, like the app's main background.

Common uses: Application background, page base layer, lowest-level containers.

Level 2. Represents elements that sit on top of the bottom layer. Creates visual hierarchy through subtle elevation.

Common uses: Cards, containers, form fields, dropdown menus.

Level 3. Represents elements that sit on top of the middle layer. Creates strong visual emphasis through maximum elevation.

Common uses: Popovers, tooltips, highlighted containers.

Highest contrast color for text and icons in important content. Creates maximum readability and emphasis for key information.

Common uses: Headings, labels, emphasized text.

Primary color for text and icons in general content. Provides optimal readability for extended reading while reducing visual strain.

Common uses: Body text, primary content, default icons, form inputs.

Reduced emphasis color for text and icons in secondary information. Creates visual hierarchy through lower contrast.

Common uses: Supporting text, metadata, secondary information, placeholders.

Primary color for text and icons in success content. Communicates positive outcomes and completion states.

Common uses: Success message text, completion text, positive indicators.

Primary color for text and icons in error content. Communicates problems, warnings, and destructive actions.

Common uses: Error message text, validation text, destructive action labels.

Primary color for text and icons in warning content. Communicates caution and potential issues requiring attention.

Common uses: Warning message text, alert text, important notifications.

Enhanced border color for interactive states. Creates strong visual definition for important boundaries.

Common uses: Focus states, hover states, active elements, primary containers.

Standard border color for general use. Provides balanced visual definition for common UI elements.

Common uses: Containers, cards, dividers, separators, default form inputs.

Softer border color for minimal separation. Creates subtle visual boundaries that don't dominate the UI.

Common uses: Subtle dividers, grouped content, secondary containers, table rows.

Focus state indicator color. Provides clear visual feedback for keyboard navigation and accessibility.

Common uses: Focus rings, keyboard navigation highlights, selection indicators.

Border color for success containers. Reinforces positive status through visual framing.

Common uses: Success alert borders, confirmation boundaries, completed state indicators.

Border color for error containers. Emphasizes critical information through visual framing.

Common uses: Error alert borders, validation boundaries, destructive action containers.

Border color for warning containers. Frames cautionary information with distinct boundary.

Common uses: Warning alert borders, notice boundaries, attention-requiring elements.

Light overlay for gentle interactive effects. Creates subtle visual feedback during user interaction.

Common uses: Button hover states, link hover states, soft interactions, menu items.

Strong overlay for emphasized selection states. Creates distinct visual indication of active or selected elements.

Common uses: Selected list items, active tabs, chosen options, current navigation item.

Lowest emphasis text color for unavailable options. Creates visual differentiation between interactive and non-interactive elements.

Common uses: Disabled buttons, inactive form elements, unavailable options, placeholders.

Muted background color for disabled elements. Reduces visual prominence of non-interactive elements in the UI.

Common uses: Disabled buttons, inactive form controls, unavailable options.

Muted border color for disabled element boundaries. Creates subtle containment while indicating non-interactive state.

Common uses: Disabled form inputs, inactive controls, unavailable action boundaries.
Disabled text or icon element for selected component behavior.
Disabled background for selected component behavior.
Disabled border for selected component behavior.

Inset border color for avatars. Creates subtle definition inside the avatar element.

backdrop.$description: Overlay color behind dialog components. Creates focus on the dialog by dimming content underneath.

backdrop-nested.$description: Overlay color behind dialog components. Creates focus on the dialog by dimming content underneath.

description.$value: Neutral base color for the diff interface that allows code and difference highlights to remain visually prominent.
Green background highlighting newly added code lines while maintaining readability.
Background for line numbers of added code, providing visual connection to added content.
Stronger emphasis color for specific character changes within added lines.
Background for interactive UI elements related to added content.
Text/icon color for add-related interactive elements, ensuring readability.
Red background highlighting removed code lines without causing eye strain.
Background for line numbers of deleted code, connecting numbers to removed content.
Stronger emphasis color for specific character changes within deleted lines.
Neutral background for unchanged code that allows modified content to stand out.
Background for line numbers of unchanged code, maintaining visual rhythm.
Text color for unchanged line numbers, visually subdued compared to changed content.
Background for placeholder spaces and empty lines, maintaining visual continuity.
Background for diff section headers ('hunks') that indicate which part of the file is displayed.
Background for line numbers in section headers.
Text color for section header content showing file position information.
Background for controls that expand/collapse code sections to show additional context.
Default color for text links. Creates distinct visual identification of interactive text elements.
Hover color for text links.
Visited state color for text links. Differentiates links the user has already activated.
Border color for pipeline connection arrows. Defines the visual path between pipeline components.
Gradient border color for active pipeline arrows. Visually indicates data flow between active pipeline components.
Gradient background for pipeline cards. Creates a visually distinctive surface for pipeline visualization elements.
Gradient border for pipeline cards. Enhances the visual depth and distinction of pipeline components.
Animated gradient border for running pipeline states. Provides visual indication of active processing.
The background color for the primary/top-level canvas where pipeline components are arranged. Creates the base visual layer for the main workflow area.
Solid border for the outermost pipeline canvas elements. Defines the boundaries of the top-level workflow container.
Background color for nested/secondary canvas elements that appear within the main workflow. Provides visual distinction for grouped pipeline components.
Border styling applied to nested canvas containers. Creates clear visual boundaries between different sections within the pipeline visualization.
Refers to the dotted pattern visible in the background of the workspace.
Text color for Logo in sidebar navigation.
Icon color for Logo in sidebar navigation.
Color for scrollbar thumb/handle elements. Provides subtle contrast against the scrollbar track for improved usability.
Color for unselected items in selection controls. Provides readable but less emphasized styling for available options.
Background color for unselected state in selection controls. Creates visual distinction from selected items.
Border color for unselected elements in selection controls. Defines the clickable area with a visible boundary.
Color for selected items in selection controls. Creates high contrast against selected background state.
Background color for selected state in selection controls. Creates strong visual indication of active selection.
Border color for selected elements in selection controls. Reinforces the selected state with consistent styling.
Animation color that sweeps across skeleton elements. Creates a "shimmer" effect indicating content loading states.
Background color for slider tracks. Represents the full range of available values in an unselected state.
Filled portion color for slider tracks. Visually represents the selected value or range within the track.
Color for segment markers on the unfilled track portion. Creates visual indicators for specific values or intervals.
Color for segment markers on the filled track portion. Maintains visibility of markers within the selected range.
Background color for slider handles. Creates a distinct, interactive element for adjusting values.
Border color for slider handles. Provides definition and contrast for the interactive control.

No shadow. 
Common uses: Flat designs, disabled states, removing shadows on mobile.

Small shadow. 
Common uses: Buttons in their rest state, form inputs, subtle UI elements.

Default shadow. 
Common uses: Cards, dropdowns, popovers in their default state.

Medium shadow. 
Common uses: Elevated cards, active buttons, interactive elements on hover.

Large shadow. 
Common uses: Modals, floating panels, navigation dropdowns.

Extra large shadow. 
Common uses: Large modals, sidebars, elevated content sections.

Extra extra large shadow.
Common uses: This aggressive shadow is typically used sparingly in UI design, primarily for elements that need maximum visual emphasis and elevation.

Inner shadow. 
Common uses: Pressed buttons, selected states, inset form fields.
Transparent shadow color. Used when no shadow effect is desired.
Light shadow color with 40% opacity. Creates subtle depth for small UI elements.
Medium shadow color with 40% opacity. Provides balanced depth for common UI components.
Medium shadow color with 35% opacity. Creates moderate depth for elevated components.
Deep shadow color with 35% opacity. Provides significant depth for floating elements.
Very deep shadow color with 35% opacity. Creates dramatic elevation for modal content.
Extremely deep shadow color with 40% opacity. Provides maximum depth for highly elevated elements.
Subtle inner shadow color with 7% opacity. Creates inset effect for pressed or focused states.
Focus ring effect with background offset and accent border.
